author: pipermerriam
content: <@!291925846556540928> <@!203220829473996800> what do you guys think about bountying the extraction of the ssz spec into a stand-alone format along with the creation of more comprehensive documention that is more focused on being accessible to onboarding new people to the format?

author: protolambda
content: We've had a bad experience with SSZ bounty in the past. Extensions/new abstracted features are a very niche topic, hiring/bounties are hard enough for more common things. When you bounty something, it needs to be somewhat familiar to others to get good results. Otherwise no submissions, or people get stuck and abandon their work. That said, if it's purely a documentation goal, to onboard rather than to dig deep, it may work fine.
